DataElement.preferredName: T2-Weighted Magnetic Resonance Imaging Performed Negation Administration Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason a T2-Weighted MRI was not administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) that creates contrast between tissues based on differences in the transverse relaxation of a tissue's net magnetization vector; it measures the time taken for spinning protons to lose phase coherence among the nuclei spinning perpendicular to the main field. This MRI sequence is produced by using a longer time to echo (TE) and repetition time (TR) than a T1-weighted sequence.:Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) that creates contrast between tissues based on differences in the transverse relaxation of a tissue's net magnetization vector; it measures the time taken for spinning protons to lose phase coherence among the nuclei spinning perpendicular to the main field. This MRI sequence is produced by using a longer time to echo (TE) and repetition time (TR) than a T1-weighted sequence.

Concepts.definition: A method of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) that creates contrast between tissues based on differences in the transverse relaxation of a tissue's net magnetization vector; it measures the time taken for spinning protons to lose phase coherence among the nuclei spinning perpendicular to the main field. This MRI sequence is produced by using a longer time to echo (TE) and repetition time (TR) than a T1-weighted sequence.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 1/10/23 Released for CCTG cjl;11/13/23 Created DEC for CCTG ticket number CADSR0003018 cjl.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Adverse Event Related To Radiation Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Adverse Event Related To Radiation Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).: A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Activities involved in the performance of executive, supervisory, or managerial duties.

Concepts.definition: Activities involved in the performance of executive, supervisory, or managerial duties.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts or/and supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures; monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (i.e., under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject), collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.: A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.
A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any disease or disorder of relevance that occurs before, during or after another illness.

Concepts.definition: Any disease or disorder of relevance that occurs before, during or after another illness.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
